text: Human rights in Uzbekistan have been described as "abysmal" [extremely bad] by Human Rights Watch. The country has received heavy criticism from the U.K. and the U.S. The reasons were: possible unjustified arrests, religious persecution and torture used by both regional and national governments. == LGBT rights == Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan are the only post-Soviet states where male homosexual activity is still a criminal offence. ==References== Uzbekistan Category:Uzbekistan
title: Human rights in Uzbekistan
